from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, IntegerType, StringType, TimestampType

# Inicializar sesi贸n Spark
spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()

# Crear sesi贸n de Spark
spark = SparkSession.builder.appName("ETL_Claims").getOrCreate()

# Configurar las credenciales de acceso para Azure Blob Storage
spark.conf.set("fs.azure.account.auth.type.azdatadp900.dfs.core.windows.net", "SAS")
spark.conf.set("fs.azure.sas.data.azdatadp900.dfs.core.windows.net", "sp=r&st=2025-02-23T15:36:28Z&se=2025-02-23T23:36:28Z&spr=https&sv=2022-11-02&sr=c&sig=vO%2BSLZG%2B%2BCoClsCsDIpVc9V9NHejdJVuhtLzPT79IcU%3D")

# Definir la ruta del Data Lake
data_lake_path = "abfss://data@azdatadp900.dfs.core.windows.net/"

# Verificar la ruta del Data Lake
print(f"Data Lake Path: {data_lake_path}")

# Funci贸n para cargar datos con manejo de errores
def load_data(path):
    try:
        return spark.read.format("csv").option("header", "true").option("inferSchema", "true").load(path)
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error loading data from {path}: {e}")
        return None

# Cargar los datos desde el Data Lake con configuraci贸n adecuada
df_clients = load_data(f"{data_lake_path}clients.csv")
df_policies = load_data(f"{data_lake_path}policies.csv")
df_claims = load_data(f"{data_lake_path}claims.csv")
